Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the bullock cart protests by linking them to the farmers' movement and suggesting that it has reached the most remote villages.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that farmers in remote areas are holding protests with bullock carts.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photo of the bullock carts is evidence of the widespread reach of the farmer protests, without considering alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The photo of the bullock carts is actually from a two-year-old Congress rally organized by the Youth Congress to protest against the rising prices of petrol and diesel, suggesting an alternative explanation for the image.
